p: For the carbohydrate quantification with HPLC, fermentation broth samples were pre-treated and analyzed as described by Buchholz et al. ( 2013) with slight modifications. A protocol for phosphate precipitation was applied before measurement. 1 mL of culture supernatant was mixed with 45 μL 4 M NH 3 and 100 μL 1.2 M MgSO 4, incubated for 5 min at RT and subsequently centrifuged for 5 min at 13,000 rpm. 500 μL of the resulting supernatant was then mixed with 500 μL 0.1 M H 2SO 4, incubated for 15 min followed by centrifugation for 15 min at 13,000 rpm. The supernatant was used for HPLC analysis of the carbohydrates as described by Siebenhaller et al. ( 2018). Calibration with pure glucose and xylose ranged from 10 to 500 mg/L.
